{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3549807,"name":"Kevin ","username":"kr1699","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kr1699/{size}/207533_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-06T21:30:36.019Z","cooked":"

We are trying to implement MAXmotion on our pivot. Is the max velocity and max acceleration relative to the built in encoder or the absolute encoder we have plugged in which is being used for the feedback loop?

Also, feel free to give your strongly worded opinion about maxmotion if anyone would like to suggest an alternative. We were using the normal rev position PID before but want to limit our acceleration and velocity, hence the switch to the trapezoid profile on maxmotion.

The velocity should be based on whichever sensor you set as the sensor you want to use for feedback.

kr1699:

We are trying to implement MAXmotion on our pivot.

Don’t. Use the PID position mode and an on-RIO TrapezoidProfile. MaxMotion is a trap, because you can’t send it a sensible feedforward for an arm.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-03-06T21:43:08.126Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":58,"readers_count":57,"score":31.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":494542,"topic_slug":"maxmotion-on-absolute-encoder-or-motor-encoder","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/maxmotion-on-absolute-encoder-or-motor-encoder/494542/4","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3561348,"name":"Kevin ","username":"kr1699","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kr1699/{size}/207533_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-19T01:20:20.861Z","cooked":"

We are trying this but I am running into confusion. The example of this for command based shows using a timer, sampling the timer + .02, and then supplying an empty value and a target as the other two parameters for the trapezoid profile to get the next setpoint. Is this how I should be doing it?

Should I be supplying an accurate position and just setting .02 as t? Or is it because the trapezoid assumes that the trajectory has been accurately followed so far that I can continue to sample from that initial 0 state and adding .02 to the elapsed time to get my new target position.

I’m replying late because we never got time to implement profiling and just ran a PD controller at our first event, but we’re trying to improve for this weekend.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-03-19T01:20:20.861Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":28,"readers_count":27,"score":10.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":494542,"topic_slug":"maxmotion-on-absolute-encoder-or-motor-encoder","display_username":"Kevin ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":12381,"username":"Oblarg","name":"Eli Barnett","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61741,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/maxmotion-on-absolute-encoder-or-motor-encoder/494542/5","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3561350,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-19T01:24:43.633Z","cooked":"

You should just step forward in time from the previous setpoint. Measurements only get fed to the feedback.
